intro: Cinnamomum gaudichaudii, commonly known as the New Caledonian cinnamon, is a species of flowering plant in the laurel family. It is native to the island of New Caledonia in the Pacific Ocean and is characterized by its aromatic, cinnamon-like bark. The plant typically grows as a small tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are革质 (leathery) and elliptical in shape, while its flowers are small and clustered in panicles. The bark is highly valued for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine and as a spice.
